verdict.summary: The AI Safety Filter feature requires improvements to ensure compliance with Indian data protection laws. The immediate removal of content without human review may raise concerns under Section 72A of the Information Technology Act, 2000 regarding fair and transparent processing. Implementing reasonable security practices for handling sensitive personal data as per the Indian Privacy Policy Act 2018 is also necessary.

issues.title: Lack of Human Review
issues.description: The immediate removal of flagged content without human review may conflict with Section 72A's requirements for fair and transparent processing.
issues.impact: Potential legal penalties under the Information Technology Act, 2000.
issues.remediation: Implement human review of flagged content before removal.

issues.title: Inadequate Security Practices
issues.description: The feature must implement reasonable security practices for handling sensitive personal data as per the Indian Privacy Policy Act 2018.
issues.impact: Potential legal penalties under the Indian Privacy Policy Act 2018.
issues.remediation: Establish and maintain a security policy that meets the requirements of the Indian Privacy Policy Act 2018.

evidence_cited.content: Any body corporate which possesses, deals or handles any sensitive personal data or information shall be responsible for protecting the privacy of such data or information in a manner provided under this Act.

whoever, intentionally or knowingly discloses, uses for financial gain or otherwise, publishes or distributes any personal information in violation of the privacy terms under which such information was obtained or a contract or as is otherwise required by law, shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years or with fine which may extend to one lakh rupees or with both.
